title: Experienced UI/UX Designer - AI Startup
description: Note: For this position we are looking for Eastern Europe based UI/UX designer only, with at least 3 years of experience - preferably 5 and above. Details:Contrast is a renowned UI/UX Design Agency, led by Sagi Shrieber - the first UI/UX Designer at Fiverr, who later has built and sold his startup to Similarweb and became the first designer at Similarweb.We take pride in our advanced UI/UX frameworks that drive business results.We work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment, where innovation is encouraged and your growth is our priority.About the Job:Were looking for a designer for a 5 days a week project with a client- a new AI startup, mixing the worlds of AI and Performance Marketing.The designer would be client-facing therefore would need to know how to speak English fluently and communicate his/her design flawlessly over zoom. Requirements:- 4+ years of professional experience in UI/UX design, specifically web design.- Proficiency in English, with exceptional communication skills, to effectively articulate design concepts and solutions to team members and clients.- An intimate understanding of Figma, along with an awareness of its latest features and functionalities.- Demonstrable experience in building professional design systems and adhering to them.- Strong prototyping and mock-up skills, with the ability to quickly communicate designs to clients.- The knack for working remotely and commitment to a full-time contractor role (5 days/week).Whats on Offer:- Opportunity to work with a super experienced team, surrounded by talented designers who are leading in the field of UI/UX design.- Regular exposure to advanced frameworks that will expand your design toolkit and enhance your professional growth.- A supportive learning environment where you will be encouraged to master our frameworks and apply them to your design work.- Being part of a vibrant team that fosters a culture of creativity, collaboration, and innovation.Are you ready to elevate your career in UI/UX design and create a positive impact on digital experiences? Apply and share your portfolio that best showcases your UIUX capabilities.We at Contrast are looking forward to making a difference together!(Note: This is a fully remote position)

title: Product Designer, Growth
description: Loom is the video communication platform for async work that helps companies communicate better at scale. Loom makes it easy to record quick videos of your screen and camera and instantly share them with a link. More than 14M users across more than 200k companies around the world trust Loom to share feedback, updates, intros, training, and more – every day. Founded in late 2015, Loom has raised $203M from world-class investors including Andreessen Horowitz, Sequoia, Kleiner Perkins, Iconic, and Coatue.Loom DesignDesign is a vital organization at Loom. By radically improving the experience of recording and sharing quick video messages, we are creating a new and more humane way of communicating at work. This requires us to think big and to discover and explore uncharted territory. Thats why were focused on building a diverse, and resilient design organization, full of talented people who love feedback and collaboration. Loom is a remote-first company, and Design is no exception: were hiring the best Designers, Researchers, and Writers from around the world, wherever they are. The RoleWe’re hiring a Product Designer to help design the future of Loom as we grow our user base. Growth Product Designers work on initiatives that increase the amount of creators, viewers, and teams on Loom – empowering millions of people to communicate faster and more effectively at work. You will be a part of a tight-knit team, delivering massive value through both small, iterative tests and foundational, vision projects. Some examples of the work you will be doing are improvements to our new user onboarding, increasing team invites, and helping users build a habit with Loom. You’ll partner with every team across Product, Design, Marketing, and Engineering to help drive activation, engagements and team expansion. You will define best practices, design for challenges both big and small, and lay the foundations for our product for years to come. Responsibilities Design delightful and educational onboarding experiences that give people the confidence, context and understanding to record and share their first Looms. Educating users how to form a habit of communicating with video at work through nudges and other educational levers Carve paths for teams and individuals to easily invite and engage with teammates on loom Simplify our roles and self-serve funnel to drive monetization amongst individuals and teams Help drive our core metrics for activation, engagement, acquisition, and monetization Be a key part of a well-rounded team of Design, PM and Engineering. Contribute to the Lens Design System Work cross-functionally with Product and Engineering partners to represent the design team, and give feedback in critique, roadmapping, sprint planning, and product and design Slack channels. Help Recruit and interview new Product Designers, and actively improve our inclusive design hiring process. What Were Looking For Experience in Product Design organizations that have shipped software to users, working closely with Product and Engineering teammates to develop the strategy and rationale for features. Demonstrable experience working with data, conducting and measuring product design experiments, and a passion for setting and achieving OKRs and metrics that materially impact the business. An outstanding portfolio, with presentable case studies showcasing a foundation in typography, interaction and visual design, product sense, and idea generation. Experience collaborating with a diverse team in a rapid growth environment. Huge plus if you’ve worked with remote teammates and understand the communication patterns of working with highly distributed teams. A learning and growth mindset: We’re an early-stage startup, and we’re growing quickly. Our team size and our design process will evolve and change many times over the next few years. We strive to continuously improve, iterate, and integrate what we learn — from our work and with each other. Experience with prototyping as a means to explore and convey design solutions. Empathy and resilience: empathy for our customers, to build a product and a service they’ll love. Empathy for our coworkers, to build a workplace we’ll love. Resilience to be able to take feedback from anywhere, consider it gracefully, and fold it into your thinking and your work. Excellent written, verbal, and storytelling skills How We WorkFreedom and Flexibility: At Loom, we believe work is an act, not a place. When we disengage work from a location, we can accommodate a broad range of life choices. You can choose to work from home or while you travel. We are able to hire across the United States and are continuing to expand our international presence. And you are free to move within a country without any adjustment to compensation. Engaging Workday: The key to an engaging workday is finding the right balance between different ways to work sync, async, text and video. Loom makes it easier for us to say what we mean without having to schedule a zoom meeting or struggle to find the right words. And using async communication allows us to free up time for deep work every day. We believe theres a place for sync time - often a conversation on Zoom is exactly what is needed. For team meetings, this ‘sync time’ is typically between 9AM-Noon PT given where the overlap of timezones where Loommates are located.Work-Rest Balance: The way we balance the fast-paced demands of a high-growth startup and sustainability is making rest a priority. We offer a flexible PTO policy so youre able to take time off when you need it. We also go fully offline for Summer Break around 4th of July and between Christmas and New Years. Rest is also part of the workday, not just during PTO. Taking a break for personal commitments, whether its watching the kids or getting some exercise is a natural part of the workday.Social Connection: Relationships and connectedness matter. We are intentional about building trust and relationships through unique, shared experiences. Our virtual workspace keeps us connected day-to-day whether its through Looms celebrating wins or our buzzing Slack communities. Loommates are able to meet in person with their teams at least twice a year purely for fun. We have also built local offices for those who want to work or meet in person, starting with San Francisco and New York City.Perks at Loom Competitive compensation and equity package 99% company paid medical, dental, and vision coverage for employees and dependents (for US employees) Flexible Spending Account (FSA) and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account (DCFSA) Healthcare reimbursement (for International employees) Life, AD&D, Short and Long Term Disability Insurance 401(k) with 4% company matching Professional development reimbursement Wellness stipends Unlimited PTO Paid parental leave Remote work opportunities Home office & technology reimbursement Loom = Equal Opportunity EmployerWe are actively seeking to create a diverse work environment because teams are stronger with different perspectives and experiences.We value a diverse workplace and encourage women, people of color, LGBTQIA individuals, people with disabilities, members of ethnic minorities, foreign-born residents, older members of society, and others from minority groups and diverse backgrounds to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, gender, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. All employees and contractors of Loom are responsible for maintaining a work culture free from discrimination and harassment by treating others with kindness and respect.

title: Product/Marketing Designer for SaaS App
description: About the job:DesignFiles is an interior design project management software company on a mission to help interior designers and home furnishing retailers take their design services and businesses to new heights. With 5,000+ customers and 20+ team members located all over the world, were growing quickly and looking for our next driven and talented team member.We’re looking for a Product/Marketing Designer to join the company to help drive product design from the ground level.What youll do: Create intuitive, user-friendly, and visually appealing user interfaces for our software products, ensuring a seamless and delightful user experience. Collaborate closely with product managers and developers to understand user needs, translate them into design concepts, and iterate on designs based on user feedback. Conduct user research and usability testing to gather insights and validate design decisions. Help design and maintain a consistent visual identity and brand guidelines across all marketing materials, including website, landing pages, social media graphics, and email campaigns. Collaborate with the marketing team to create compelling visual assets that effectively communicate our value proposition to our target audience. Stay up to date with the latest design trends, industry best practices, and emerging technologies to continuously improve our software and marketing materials. Contribute to the development of design systems and design patterns to ensure a consistent and scalable user experience across our software products. What we want from you: Proven experience as a UI/UX designer with a strong portfolio showcasing your design skills and attention to detail. Proficiency in design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch, Figma, or similar software. Solid understanding of user-centered design principles and best practices, with a keen eye for aesthetics and typography. Experience conducting user research, usability testing, and gathering actionable insights. Understanding of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to effectively present and justify design decisions to cross-functional teams. Self-motivated, proactive, and able to manage multiple projects and deadlines simultaneously. Passion for interior design, architecture, or related industries is a plus. Sound interesting?:Then wed love to hear about you! Please apply here: https://designfiles.homerun.co/ui-ux-marketing-designer-for-saas-app/en

title: Product Designer
description: Product Designer (UI/UX)London, HybridAt Geomiq, we’re inspired every day by our customers and teammates.Geomiq is the UK’s leading Digital Manufacturing Marketplace. An innovative B2B MaaS (Manufacturing as a Service) platform and Artificial Intelligence (AI) powered system that connect buyers and sellers with unprecedented efficiency. Conventional manufacturing is infamously challenging for companies both big and small. We’re tackling that head on by making reliable manufacturing methods instantly available to engineers all over the world through our digital platform. Empowering every one of our customers to create revolutionary products faster, Geomiq democratises access to transparent & predictable manufacturing.If youre looking for a B2B tech scale-up selling into some of the world’s leading brands from BMW, Rolls Royce to Brompton Bikes & Google look no further (we have even supported space missions!) We are Manufacturing the Futurewww.geomiq.comAbout the TeamA London based tech start-up and a team of entrepreneurs with a proven track record. We are solving our own problem (one we faced every day as engineers) of how difficult it is to order custom manufactured parts via conventional manufacturing, we are on a mission!The Product team interacts with all facets of the business, supporting and advising on the day to day running and building automated solutions to problems faced with our Product. We are a small team made up of a Head of Product and a Product Manager, looking for someone keen to make an impact..Our culture is friendly but incredibly fast paced – we are constantly challenging, testing and adapting the way we do things. We’re also really committed to working with integrity, doing the right thing, and building a company we are truly proud of. We’re growing super-fast but we also want to make sure that we are building a company on really solid foundations.We take extreme care with who we hire, and all team members are superbly talented and incredibly motivated. If you’re brilliant AND humble, you’ll fit right in.Our ProductA revolutionary platform that completely digitises the existing process of quoting and ordering of custom manufactured parts whilst ensuring the highest operational and quality outcomes. Our main customers are Design Engineers, Mechanical Engineers and Procurement teams building the world’s most innovative products.Check out the platform here: www.geomiq.com, and view a video of the platform in action: https://vimeo.com/536361036About the RoleAre you a talented Product Designer who would like to join a rapidly growing start up within the manufacturing and engineering industry?Key Responsibilities Partner with product and engineering to drive the design of new products and features for our platform Create user-centred designs by understanding our business and our customers Quickly and iteratively create user flows, wireframes, prototypes, low and high-fidelity mock-ups Validate designs and experiences through experimentation and direct customer testing You will own the end-to-end design initiative across all phases of the product development process from discovery to implementation Champion design craft, continually evolving processes to be more effective and efficient What are we looking for?Experience required: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience 3+ years’ experience in Product Design Experience creating user flows, personas, wireframes, mockups and prototypes Proficient with design tools such as Figma, Sketch, InVision and Adobe CS Experience in launching software or services in partnership with engineering teams Experience working with an in-house product team Desired Experience Experience working in the B2B space Start-up experience Experience working in a digital marketplace Benefits Competitive salary Stocked Kitchen of snacks, fruit etc 32 days annual leave with an extra day off for your birthday Bi-weekly social events Monthly Team events Culture of internal progression Cycle to work scheme Quarterly Wellbeing Days Summer and Winter Socials More to come as we grow...

title: Senior Product Designer
description: Ahoy there!Our agency is seeking a contractor-based Senior Product Designer with 7+ years experience to join our crew!Were looking for a candidate experienced in product design and project management who is passionate about creating cutting-edge, modern design interfaces while understanding how to think from an end user’s perspective to create meaningful experiences that tell stories and increase engagement.RESPONSIBILITIES Craft intuitive, engaging, and memorable user interfaces for web and mobile applications Create wireframes, high-fidelity designs, and interactive prototypes to help visualize design ideas and solutions Create information architectures, user flows, user journey maps, etc. to ensure a smooth user experience Craft design solutions for websites, web apps, mobile apps, smart watch, and the like using Figma Create low-fidelity and high-fidelity design concepts, taking design projects from kickoff, through concept, to final product Collaborate directly with clients, leading and guiding design projects from inception to completion Test designs to ensure usability and accessibility Visualize user experiences (UX) and create user interfaces (UI) for a wide variety of clients, industries, and audiences Maintain brand and design element consistency across platforms Are familiar with the latest UX Research Methodologies and can conduct UX Research sessions and drive productivity Work collaboratively with our highly skilled design, development, product management crew, and other stakeholders to convert business requirements into effective product experiences Participate in client meetings, including leading presentations and asking questions to acquire all information necessary to help make informed design decisions to complete projects accurately and efficiently Are up-to-date on the latest design trends and technologies to create cutting-edge design solutions QUALIFICATIONS Expertise using Figma as your primary design program Proficient creating Figma prototypes Extensive experience in design, ideally in a senior/lead role within an agency environment Must have experience designing for numerous product UIs including websites, dashboards, SaaS platforms, mobile apps, smart watch, design systems, etc. Must have experience designing mobile-responsive websites and applications, coupled with a strong understanding of responsive design principles Must have the ability to turn internal and client feedback into effective design concepts and visuals Must be able to manage a project from client interaction to design-to-development handoff, followed by QA Must understand the collaboration relationship between design and development Must have experience working with developers to create implementation-ready layouts, assets, and resources A demonstrated passion for design, storytelling, products, & brands Experience working with clients directly (conference calls and emails when necessary) Experience with balancing and managing multiple projects simultaneously Experienced and competent in design & application best practices Able to communicate through Slack and Google Meet Able to work independently, are self-managed and self-motivated, proactive, and able to thrive in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment BONUSES Experience animating interfaces using After Effects, Principle, etc. Experience creating animations & micro-animations Experience creating vectors, SVGs, & illustrations Actively participating on popular creative community platforms like Dribbble or Behance There is a lot of potential to grow with us! Most of all, expect to have fun and push yourself to new heights!ABOUT OUR AGENCYBlack Flag Creative is a web design and mobile app agency anchored in Los Angeles, California. We specialize in UX/UI design, web design, product design, web development, mobile interface design, mobile app development, iOS apps, Android apps, SaaS platforms, dashboards, and brand identity. We are passionate about offering our skills to create amazing products for those anywhere from growing startups and small companies to big organizations, brands, and Fortune 500s. Black Flag works with forward-thinking companies to make an impact in the world through digital product experiences.HOW TO APPLYIf your background and experience aligns with who were looking for, please apply!https://blackflagcreative.com/careersThanks for your interest and we’re excited to meet you!

title: UX Design Lead (Freelance)
description: Join us in shaping a unified learning experience for an enterprise software company.About Studio Malagón:Studio Malagón is a visual design and branding studio, driven by ideas and experiences that inspire. We craft design solutions to create moments of connection between our clients and their audiences. Based in Austin with collaborators across the United States, we embrace the flexibility and innovation that comes with remote work.The Project:Weve partnered with an enterprise software company to unify their diverse learning experiences into a single platform. As one of the lead UX designers for the clients team, your role will be crucial in this endeavor. Your collaboration with the client team—which includes product managers, engineers, and other lead UX designers—will be instrumental in addressing complex challenges and ensuring consistency throughout this expansive team effort.Your Role: Focus primarily on user experience design, including user journeys and wireframes. This project has a 90% emphasis on UX design and 10% on UI (visual) design. Synthesize and apply three years of user experience research conducted by our client. Redesign the training platform to enhance the user experience based on the research. Develop a prototype of the improved training experience by April, spotlighting well-defined user journeys. Collaborate with the clients UX team, ensuring that our designs align with their initiatives. Dedicate 20 hours per week to this project for an estimated 8–12 months. Ideal Candidate:You are a seasoned UX designer skilled at managing complex tasks and making impactful design recommendations. Youve demonstrated expertise in handling large-scale enterprise projects and have the capacity to work independently while excelling in teamwork, especially when interacting with client teams. This freelance role requires a commitment of 20 hours per week for 8–12 months, pushing the boundaries of your design skills and offering an enriching challenge.Qualifications: Proven track record as a senior user experience designer. Experience in handling complex UX projects and solving intricate design problems. Portfolio demonstrating your design capabilities. Strong teamwork skills and adaptability to changing needs. Ability to function both independently and collaboratively as a vital part of our team. To Apply:Are you excited by this unique project and confident in your ability to enhance our team? Wed love to hear from you. Send your resume, portfolio, and a brief cover letter outlining why youd be an exceptional fit to admin@studiomalagon.com.Please Note:This is a freelance position, not a full-time employment opportunity with Studio Malagón or the clients company. We seek independent contractors who can devote roughly 20 hours per week for the projects duration.

title: Multimedia Designer
description: The Association of Proposal Management Professionals (APMP) Marketing Department is hiring a creative and detail-oriented Multimedia Designer responsible for the creative and visual production of quality, creative storytelling using the Adobe Creative Suite.As a Multimedia Designer, you will play a crucial role in creating visually compelling and engaging multimedia content to support our marketing and communication initiatives, both online and offline. You will be both a graphic designer and a video producer.About the OrganizationThe Association of Proposal Management Association represents 12,000+ bid, capture, and business development professionals who identify, write, manage, or service bids for their organizations. APMP members are responsible for winning new work for their organizations, and its members are seen as a primarily economic engine in their company. APMP is a U.S.-based non-profit association with 29 chapters worldwide. APMP was formed in 1989.APMP operates in a 100% virtual environment, which means this position often operates independently. This position reports to a supervisor who lives and works in the United States (in the Central Standard Time zone)Multimedia Designer Responsibilities: Design and develop multimedia assets: Utilize your creative skills and expertise in multimedia design to conceptualize, design, and produce a wide range of multimedia assets, including but not limited to icons, graphics, illustrations, animations, videos, and infographics. Visual storytelling: Develop visual narratives that effectively convey key messages, brand identity, and product features through compelling multimedia content. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand project goals and objectives and transform them into visually appealing and impactful designs. Brand consistency: Ensure that all multimedia designs adhere to brand guidelines and visual standards, maintaining a consistent and cohesive brand presence across various platforms and channels. Implement design elements that enhance brand recognition and resonate with our target audience. Multimedia production: Use industry-standard software and tools to create and edit multimedia content. This includes graphic design software, video editing software, animation software, and other relevant tools to produce high-quality deliverables. Collaboration and communication: Work closely with the marketing team and other stakeholders to understand project requirements, provide creative input, and deliver projects within established timelines. Effectively communicate ideas and collaborate on multimedia projects to ensure alignment with overall marketing strategies. Project management and deadlines: Manage multiple projects simultaneously, prioritize tasks with your supervisor, and meet project deadlines without compromising quality. Ensure efficient workflow and effective time management to deliver high-quality multimedia assets on time. Multimedia Designer Requirements: At least three years’ experience in a similar role. You must have a portfolio of multimedia design content showcasing your skills and experience to be considered for this position. In-depth knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Premiere Pro, After Effects). Strong creative skills with the ability to develop compelling visual narratives and translate complex ideas into visually appealing designs. An eye for aesthetics, composition, color, and typography. Ability to collaborate on long-term projects. Excellent knowledge of storyboarding and visual design principles.. Artistic with an eye for aesthetics and visually appealing content. Good communication and interpersonal skills. Compensation:€52,000/year or £45,000/year

title: Senior product designer
description: About BurqBurq started with an ambitious mission: how can we turn the complex process of offering delivery into a simple turnkey solution.We started with building the largest network of delivery networks, partnering with some of the biggest delivery companies. We then made it extremely easy for businesses to plug into our network and start offering delivery to their customers. Now, we’re powering deliveries for some of the fastest-growing companies from retailers to startups.It’s a big mission and now we want you to join us to make it even bigger! 🚀We’re already backed by some of the Valleys leading venture capitalists, including Village Global, the fund whose investors include Bill Gates, Jeff Bezos, Mark Zuckerberg, Reid Hoffman, and Sara Blakely. We have assembled a world-class team all over the U.S.We operate at scale, but were still a small team relative to the opportunity. We have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to grow while doing the most important work of your career.We want people who are unafraid to be wrong and support decisions with numbers and narrative. Here’s a quick overview of what you will be doing:Product DesignerAs the Product Designer at Burq, you will be leading web and mobile product design to transform the way businesses offer on-demand & same-day delivery. You will be part of an emerging team that is building a product to power millions of businesses with their delivery needs.Some of the responsibilities Define visual UI for mobile and web. Focusing on UI, product branding, and content presentation. Lead the initiative on UX and visual design to help evolve the design of our applications. Rapidly create multiple solutions with sketches, prototypes, and wireframes. Communicate designs and specifications in a reproducible/scalable manner. Partner closely with multiple teams including business, product, and engineering with strong interpersonal skills. Requirements 5+ years of experience in conceptual and design decisions. An online portfolio featuring your web application, mobile, and any other relevant work. Expert eye to detail for outstanding creative and visual design. You welcome feedback and also provide constructive feedback. Solid design skills. Ability to ideate quickly and create a wide array of visual directions/concepts. A passion for learning new software design trends/technologies.

title: Senior product designer
description: Queto.co is seeking a talented Product Designer to work remotely, creating user-centric, engaging UI for our innovative products. The role involves translating user needs into compelling designs, crafting user flows, wireframes, and prototypes, and driving the design language while collaborating closely with our diverse team.Ideal candidates should have a strong portfolio showcasing UI design skills and a solid understanding of UX principles, proficiency in design tools like Sketch, Figma, or Adobe XD, excellent communication skills, and the ability to manage multiple fast-paced projects. Knowledge of front-end development is a plus.To apply, send your resume and portfolio link to jobs@queto.co.Queto is an equal opportunity employer. Join us and help shape the future of our product design from wherever you are!

title: Senior User Interface Designer
description: Position SummaryThe Senior User Interface Designer is a senior role within the UI/UX Job Family focusing on delivering best-in-class user experiences for our internal and external users. This position plays an instrumental role in the technical components of the UI/UX Designs, ensuring the smooth user experiences can easily be translated into technical code and capabilities. This role serves as a senior technical role, able to translate complex designs and concepts into streamlined designs and capabilities. As a Senior User Interface Designer, you will be viewed as a subject matter expert and specialist in this field.About The TeamAs a Senior Digital Designer, you will be a key member of our innovative, nascent design team. In this role, you will be working closely with a cross-functional team of developers, product managers, and customer experience specialists to design digital systems and products that meet the evolving needs of our customers. You will have the opportunity to lead the design direction for a variety of exciting projects and bring your creative vision to life. From developing user-centered websites and mobile apps, to formalizing design systems and component libraries, you will be at the forefront of shaping the way we educate, motivate, inform, and deliver on our customer-centered values. Your work will have a significant impact on the success of our products and our ability to deliver exceptional customer experiences.Primary Qualifications Experience and knowledge of UX principles, methodologies, and design best practices. This includes user centered design and accessibility standards. Creates wireframes, design specifications, prototypes, and user flow diagrams that articulate complex user journeys across multiple webpages, touchpoints, and platforms. Experience converting complex business processes into simple, logical, easy to use systems and skilled in page design, organization, and structure of content. Works alongside product and development team to define user requirements. Ensures design standards and guidelines are maintained and shared with development teams to guide product design. Professional level knowledge of industry-standard design software (Figma, Adobe Creative Suites) Experience in responsive frontend development (HTML, CSS, Sass, etc.) and frameworks/libraries or design systems (Material Design, etc.). Sufficient understanding of project management approaches, tools and phases of the delivery lifecycle (Scrum, Kanban, Lean) and experience in JIRA, Confluence, or equivalent documentation tools. Strong active listening and collaboration skills. Ability to influence others and move toward a common vision or goal. Must be a team player and able to work collaboratively with and through others. Desired Skills 4+ years recent experience in visual design craftsmanship, combined with a keen ability to anticipate and address user needs. Help teams apply usability and design processes and tools in support of projects and initiatives. Effective problem solver with demonstrated ability to develop creative solutions that are both functional and visually appealing. Experience with both public facing and internally facing web applications. Flexible and adaptable; able to work in ambiguous situations. Resilient and tenacious with a propensity to persevere. Ability to engage with others to cultivate an environment of learning and constructive collaboration. Ability to prioritize and manage work, adhering to critical project timelines. Problem solving and root cause identification skills. Superior relationship-building with a strong and approachable communication style to work effectively within cross functional teams and with all levels of the organization. Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal. Advocate and evangelize user centered design and research best practices. Conduct end to end design reviews with project teams. Consider existing insights, technical constraints, business needs, and specific platform demands to produce user centered, data driven, and design focused solutions. Play an active role in partnering with cross-functional team members in leading cohesive design standards and best practices across the enterprise. Mentor and coach Team Members on usability and design best practices. Create and provide tools that help guide teams on their journey to usable and intuitive design. Why Clayton Homes?Founded in 1956, Clayton is a Berkshire Hathaway Company committed to opening doors to a better life and Building Happyness® through homeownership. Through its family of brands, Clayton builds, sells, finances, and insures traditional site-built homes and off-site built housing – including modular homes, manufactured homes, CrossMod™ homes, tiny homes, college dormitories, military barracks, and apartments. Corporate headquarters is located in the Knoxville, Tennessee area, specifically, Maryville, Tennessee. Clayton is the recipient of numerous industry awards including 2019 Builder of the Year and ranks as the #2 builder of homes in the U.S. by units sold. Our site-built division, Clayton Properties Group, is the 8th largest site builder in the U.S. We achieve our results through the strength of our people and have been recognized on the 2021 Forbes Best Employers for Diversity and 2021 Forbes America’s Best Employers Lists. To learn more about Clayton Homes, got to: https://www.claytonhomes.comBenefits Competitive benefits including 401(k) with 100% company match of the first 4%; medical, dental and vision plans; paid time off days and holidays. Quarterly bonus program. Forbes lists: America’s Best Employers, America’s Employers by State, Best Employers for Diversity, Best Employers for Women. Recognized as one of East Tennessee’s top technology workplaces. Wellness programs that focus on emotional, social, spiritual, intellectual, environmental, physical, and financial well-being. Onsite fitness facility with full gym, workout classes, volleyball and basketball, ping-pong, and disc golf course. Paid Time Off for Volunteer work.

title: Medior/ Senior UI/UX Designer
description: TenTwenty is looking for a passionate and talented medior/ senior UI UX Designer to join our enthusiastic team. The position is full-time Remote, or from Dubai. Do you like sunny days, spending your winter weekends at the beach, getting loads of experience and putting your design skills to practice? Make sure to apply to this vacancy!Your preferred skillset Being as passionate about usability, beauty and elegance of UI’s as we are: http://tentwenty.me/showreel2023 Being unique, having a creative mind and keen eye for detail Taking project ownership where you take your responsibility within the team Eager to learn, discuss and share knowledge with our designers and developers A vast experience in the creation of UI and UX for Websites and Apps Knowing all about, personas, userflows, sitemaps, wireframes & UI/UX design Figma skills! Bringing designs to life with effects (Adobe After Effects, etc) Knowing your way around the Adobe suite Having an eye for good photography Ability to speak English fluently Having a outstanding portfolio of web design & mobile app design What we can offer you :) Since you are the best in your field, we offer you a dynamic working environment Enthusiastic team members Internal training and education when required Lots of room for your own creativity and input A fine salary with financial growth opportunities within the organization A great international working experience Interested already?

title: 360 Design Wizard for Pickem
description: Do you like Toothpicks, because Pick’em is hiring !!!! With our flavored toothpicks, yes you heard right we are selling TOOTHPICKS, we became the fastest growing confectionary brand (by reach) in just 2 months of being live. After having sold our product around the globe (biggest markets being US, UK, Germany) and breaking records in no time, we are now expanding our team.This is the perfect opportunity for someone who sees themself as a gifted allrounder and is up for a crazy journey. (Webdesign, Branddesign, 3D)Dont worry, not everything needs to be mastered yet, but the minimum is an A-Game in: Figma, Photoshop, Illustrator.Dump your Gum and join the revolution (:

title: Senior Designer Lead
description: We are looking for a talented Designer lead to join our startup on a long term. The first project will be Web Designer role with expertise in creating 3D assets tocreate amazing user experiences. You will collaborate with the design and marketingteam to conceptualize, create, and implement interactive 3D assets that enhanceoverall user engagement and satisfaction on our official website.The successful candidate will be able to translate high-level requirements intointeraction flows and artifacts. They will be able to transform them into beautiful,intuitive, and functional designs.Responsibilities: Execute all visual design stages from concept to final hand-off to engineering. Conceptualize original website design ideas that bring simplicity and user friendliness to complex roadblocks. Create wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows and site maps to communicate interaction and design ideas. Creating visual elements, effects, and animations using 3D modeling, texturing, and other techniques. Reviewing 3D arts and recommending improvements. Meeting with clients, Designers, and Directors to discuss and review projects and deadlines. Qualifications: Bachelors degree or equivalent experience in Design, Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), Graphic Design, or a similar position in the Design industry. Proven experience as a Web Designer or similar role with a strong portfolio of past projects. Proficiency in design software such as Sketch, Adobe XD, Figma, or similar tools. Familiarity with 3D modeling software of your choice. Excellent communication skills and ability to effectively present design ideas and solutions. Strong problem-solving skills with a detail-oriented mindset. A team player and having the ability to work independently. Familiarity with front-end development technologies (HTML/CSS/JavaScript) is a plus. Company: Pre-A with over 3M funding, 10M ARR and stable cashflow Fast-growing and career development opportunity Fast paced working environment Flexible working hours but results driven Stock Options We appreciate your application and we promise to refer you to all our clients (over 100 clients) if you are not a best fit for Brix

title: looking for talented ui ux designer
description: Are you a creative and passionate UX/UI designer with a keen eye for mobile and e-commerce experiences?Were on the lookout for a talented individual to take our digital platforms to the next level.If youre excited about crafting seamless and engaging user experiences for online shoppers, wed love to hear from you!About Us:We are a dynamic and forward-thinking company at the forefront of the service/entertainment industry with a national presence. As a UX/UI designer with us, youll have the opportunity to make a real impact on how our customers interact with our brand and products.Role and Responsibilities:Collaborate with cross-functional teams including product managers, developers, and marketers to create user-centered designs for our mobile and e-commerce platforms.Design and iterate on user flows, wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity mockups that enhance the shopping experience and drive conversion rates.Qualifications:Proven experience as a UX/UI designer, with a strong portfolio showcasing mobile and e-commerce design projects.Proficiency in design tools such as Adobe XD, Sketch, Figma, or similar.Solid understanding of mobile design principles, responsive design, and user-centered design methodologies.Familiarity with e-commerce and conversion optimization strategies.Strong communication skills and the ability to present and explain design concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.Looking for a long-term partnership as we have multiple domains to revamp.

title: Senior Product Designer
description: Company Overview:At Zavo, we are developing the next generation of finance tools, including multi-currency accounts, global payments, corporate cards, and expense management solutions. Our goal is to empower international businesses by saving them time and money through innovative and user-friendly financial products. We are based in London, with a dynamic team all across Europe.Role and Responsibilities:As a Product Designer / Senior UI/UX Designer at Zavo, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the user experience for our dashboard and website, ensuring they reflect our commitment to innovation and user empowerment. You will lead and mentor a talented design team, overseeing their work and fostering a collaborative and creative environment. Your responsibilities will include: Leading Design Strategy: Develop and drive the design strategy for our dashboard and website, aligning it with Zavos mission and user needs. Team Leadership: Provide guidance and leadership to the design team, ensuring the delivery of high-quality designs and fostering professional growth. User-Centric Design: Champion user-centered design principles throughout the design process, ensuring that the end product meets and exceeds user expectations. Collaboration: Collaborate cross-functionally with product managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to ensure seamless integration of design and functionality. Prototyping and Iteration: Create interactive prototypes and iterate on design concepts based on user feedback and usability testing. Design Excellence: Maintain a high standard of design excellence, continuously raising the bar for visual and interactive design quality. Qualifications: Proven experience (3+ years) in product design and UI/UX design, with a strong portfolio showcasing your design process and impactful projects. Leadership experience, preferably in overseeing design teams or projects. Proficiency in design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch, Figma, or similar. Strong understanding of user-centered design principles and usability best practices. Excellent communication skills with the ability to articulate design decisions and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. Experience in fintech or related industries is a plus. Benefits: Competitive salary: We offer a salary package that is competitive within the industry to attract top talent. Comprehensive benefits package: We provide a comprehensive benefits package that includes health insurance, dental coverage, vision care, and life insurance, ensuring your well-being and peace of mind. Possible equity compensation: As part of our commitment to recognizing and rewarding exceptional performance, eligible employees may have the opportunity to receive equity compensation, aligning their success with the companys growth. Flexible working hours: We understand the importance of work-life balance, and we offer flexible working hours to help you manage your professional and personal commitments effectively. Collaborative and stimulating environment: Join a dynamic and talented team where collaboration, innovation, and learning are highly valued. Youll have the opportunity to work alongside industry experts and contribute to cutting-edge financial solutions. This role is available both full-time and freelance

title: UX/UI Designer (Bangkok)
description: We are a team of passionate software engineers, product managers, and designers that enjoy building outstanding web and mobile applications.Millions of people use our apps. We work for companies of all sizes; from 1-person startups to Fortune 500 enterprises. We take a collaborative and product development approach, creating custom software that people will love to use and solving our clients problems so that they can focus on what they do best - better.If you want to grow together, work on challenging products and enjoy using the best tools and practices, Nimble is the right place for you! We keep our recruitment process practical and straightforward.To learn more about how we work, check our handbook named Compass, Github organization, and Medium account.Want to see what we have built? Check our Dribbble and Behance accounts.Want to keep in touch with us? Follow us on Facebook, Instagram, and LinkedIn.What You Will Do You will work in a project squad with a Product Owner and a development team (2-3 developers). Work closely with the Product Owner to make sure the product vision is aligned with the clients needs and assist in design discussions with clients. Most of the client interfacing is done by the Product Owner. Design beautiful and usable world-class web and mobile applications for our clients. Create User Journeys, Workflows, and Wireframes for the product we build for our clients. Perform User Experience Research to maximize the market-fit of the product we build for our clients. Learn new tools and techniques so that you are able to adapt to the evolving needs of our clients. Collaborate with other team members to define the internal processes and initiatives to help the company accomplish its mission. Our handbook has been written by the whole team. Why Youll Love Working Here You will be proud of any product that has our name on it. We are an engineering-focused company. Both co-founders are software engineers and led the tech teams at the most prominent e-commerce powerhouses in South East Asia. We really pay attention and care about processes, high quality, and aesthetics. Strong processes. We not only believe but also really work following agile principles. Developers work on well-sized and well-defined user stories, do estimate using points and work iteratively in short sprints (1-2 weeks). Regular one-on-one reviews to constantly improve and grow. We have a clearly defined process for our developers to level up continuously not only their technical skills but also soft skills. The vast amount of learning resources (Pluralsight, Pragpub, Leanpub, (e-)books, etc.) and yearly education allowance to step up your game. Provident Fund which allows you to save money every month and we match your monthly contributions (see more detailed info). Private medical insurance (Allianz) from day one, company care fund and social welfare coverage. MacBook, large screens, and any accessory to let you work comfortably. Casual work attire for everyone. Comfortable and modern office space environment in the heart of Bangkok next to BTS Asoke and MRT Sukhumvit (Interchange 21). Our office kitchen is fully stocked with drinks and snacks for the team. Visa and work permit for foreigners. If you live abroad, we provide a relocation assistance package consisting of a plane ticket allowance and up to 3 weeks of initial accommodation. 25 days of paid leaves/year (13 public holidays + 12 personal days). Sabbatical month every 3 years. Company outing every year. Many more perks! Job Requirements At least 3 years of professional design experience. Ability to work independently and take ownership of design projects. Master in your toolset: Sketch, Figma, Illustrator, or Photoshop. If you do not have experience in some of these tools, you must be open to learn and work on them. Constantly keeping updated with the latest design trends. Being comfortable working with engineers and product managers. Confidence in communicating in English.

title: Graphic Designer
description: Company OverviewBlue Tees Golf is a leading golf equipment manufacturer and retailer, dedicated to providing high-quality products and exceptional customer service. With a commitment to innovation and excellence, Blue Tees Golf has become a trusted name in the industry, serving golfers of all skill levels.Job SummaryBlue Tees Golf is looking for a Product Focused Graphic Designer to join our growing company. The ideal candidate will be creative and innovative to come up with unique and practical designs that will attract consumers. They should also have a strong familiarity with visually appealing color schemes and design aesthetics. Effective research skills are required to successfully research our target market and identify common customer trends.Great communication skills are important as they will interact with other employees on the design and product development teams to effectively explain certain product specifications.This position is 100% remote, full-time, and offers competitive wages and paid benefits. Duties Work with the CCO on product designs, brand direction, manuals, packaging, etc. Create designs from scratch using the guidance provided by the CCO Skills / Requirements Adobe Creative Suite, with a strong proficiency in Photoshop, In Design, Adobe XD, and After Effects Innovative Experience with small electric or stand-alone electric devices is a plus Able to create custom design concepts and assets from scratch Strong organizational skills and ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines Good spatial and visual awareness Knowledge of industrial processes and standards, as well as emerging new golf technology The ability to clearly communicate the reasoning behind design choices. Ability to work U.S. west coast hours (PT, MT) Understand the basics of golf A compelling portfolio with projects showcasing skills in product design. Education & Experience A degree in Graphic Design or Product Design is a plus. 2-5+ years of graphic design and/or product design experience Experience in product design, packaging design, manuals, etc. BenefitsCompetitive salary and bonuses Medical, dental & vision coverage 401k with Match 100% remote Paid time off, including holidays and sick leave

title: Web Designer
description: Turbo.net is helping organizations worldwide multiply employee productivity with intelligent digital workspaces. As a pioneering force in application delivery technology, Turbo.net has long been an innovator in seamless, cross-platform software delivery. But its not just our technology that sets us apart; its our commitment to providing intuitive, engaging digital employee experiences. And this is where you come in.We are seeking a visionary Web Designer who will elevate our online presence. You will be the creative force behind our homepage, product pages, and marketing materials, creating designs that stir a deep connection with our users, inspire trust, and effectively communicate the innovative nature of our offerings.Key Responsibilities Design and implement beautiful and engaging home pages, product pages, and marketing pages that highlight our technologys unique features and benefits. Develop a deep understanding of our product to create designs that communicate its value and functionality effectively. Collaborate closely with our development and marketing teams to ensure our website is aligned with our brand guidelines and communicates our brand story powerfully and consistently. Create design prototypes and UI elements, using your expert knowledge of design software. Ensure our website design is responsive and accessible across multiple platforms and devices. Participate in user and conversion testing to receive feedback, and make necessary adjustments to optimize effectiveness. Requirements Strong creative and visual design skills, with a portfolio demonstrating your ability to create engaging web designs, preferably including technical products. Ability to understand Turbo and end user computing concepts, and translate these concepts into visually appealing and understandable marketing materials. Proficiency in design software like Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop), Figma, InVision, Webflow, and other relevant tools. Ability to incorporate animated elements (Lotie, Rive or similar) preferred. Understanding of web design principles, including layout, typography, and color theory. Proficiency in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript for rapid prototyping. Experience in responsive and mobile design. Ability to understand and translate technical products into visually compelling designs. Exceptional communication skills to effectively collaborate with team members and stakeholders Bachelors degree in a relevant field, or equivalent experience, is preferred This position may be based at our Redmond, Washington office or remote. We operate in a hybrid home/office work environment.

title: Graphic Designer
description: NoBoringDesign is a remote digital design agency focused on brand and web, with team members based in the US and Europe. Founded in 2022, we have experienced rapid growth and are now seeking a talented individual to join our team.We are searching for a passionate and versatile designer who possesses strong skills in both brand and web design, along with a basic understanding of animation.Responsibilities: Designing visual identities for new brands & redesigning existing ones Designing company websites Designing marketing materials for different brands, basing on their brand guidelines Designing motion elements for brand, web and marketing purposes Presenting the ideas on a calls, and through a Loom recordings We’re looking for a person who: approaches design briefs in a creative, courageous & accurate way is aware of current industry and technology standards, social media, competitive landscape and market trends builds outstanding compositions out of given brand assets, as well as creates new ones when needed follows brand guidelines in a process of creating visual assets works in Figma & Adobe Suite works in a Europe timezone speaks English Nice to have: 3D design skills Animation skills Job Details: Fully Remote Contract Employment Full time What we offer Supportive team dynamics: Join a close-knit team of passionate professionals who foster a cooperative environment, emphasizing open communication, teamwork, and mutual support Flexibility and remote work: We value work-life balance and provide flexible working hours and remote work options Exciting projects and growth opportunities: youll engage in diverse projects for a range of clients (some of our clients have included the fastest growing startups in Silicon Valley such as Dropbox, Calm, Yelp, Loom and many others).

title: Product Designer (Contract, $110-190/hr)
description: A·Team is a VC-backed, stealth, application-only platform for senior product designers to team up with the best companies on their next big thing. After talking with hundreds of independent engineers, designers, and product folks, we heard over and over that finding vetted, high-quality, consistent clients is hard, and projects are often too small to be rewarding. A·Team matches small teams of the most talented builders in the world with companies backed by a16z, YC, Softbank, General Catalyst, etc. on a contract basis for many of their most important initiatives. We quietly launched in May 2020, and have helped A·Teamers earn $7.3+ million since.As part of A·Team, you can expect: High-paying, meaningful missions with the most audacious companies sent your way; generally $110-$190/hr, with vetted, fascinating clients doing work that matters. A·Team is picky, and only works with companies referred to us by top funds or existing members and clients such as Lyft, McGraw Hill, the former-CEO of Waze, a few new unicorns, and dozens of venture-backed startups by a16z, YC, Softbank, GC, etc. Keep 100% of what you make: we exist to empower independent builders, which is why A.Team charges a percentage on top of your standard rate. Do more with a team you like: our focus is on small, diverse, cross-functional teams of insanely talented developers, PMs, designers, growth leads, etc. This is because clients with bigger budgets & more ambitious work need teams to solve problems, not individuals to do tasks. That said, we try to keep friends together, since clients love builders who have worked together before. Full autonomy: we only want you to join teams when the timings right. Often they start around 15-20hrs/week, and last at least 3-6 months (longer if its going great, or contract-to-hire if true love is found). Small, curated, off-the-record gatherings: for conversations you wouldnt have elsewhere & connecting with other top-tier builders who you may like to collaborate with. How to apply:Go here: https://build.a.team/dribbble + mention Dribbble under how did you hear about A·Team? No resume or cover letter needed; we respect your time so the application is short. Were super interested in seeing what youve made, so drop in a link to your Dribbble profile. Excited to chat more real soon if there’s a fit.What you’ll do: Once part of A.Team, you’ll regularly be invited to impactful missions that match your interests, which you can accept or decline. Take your pick from early-stage incubations with world-class founders, to fast-growing super-funded companies, to old school non-tech incumbents looking to build as a tech giant would Missions usually involve building an ambitious piece of software from 0 to 1 as part of a small 3-4 person team. You’ll be paid to scope it out, give the client options, guide strategy, and execute on the selected solution. Sometimes the client has a clear vision, sometimes not; which is why A.Team builders tend to be senior folks who can work together to find the right direction. Who A·Team is for: Senior product designers who left large companies and high-growth startups to pursue their craft with autonomy. Those who prefer consistent contract work over a full-time role, who want to create a variety of new products alongside other top-tier builders. The majority of A.Teamers spend most of their time doing independent work, but a sizeable percentage are either employed full-time (but testing out client work), bootstrapping a side project, or looking for their next big thing Who A·Team is not for: People looking for small gigs Folks looking to build simple wordpress/wix/squarespace-style websites Those still early in their careers and recent university/bootcamp grads (at least not yet) Our long-term vision:A·Team is a new type of company for a new kind of independent software builder. We call them unhirables: people who traditional companies couldn’t hire full-time even if they wanted to, but who want to do their most meaningful work with their favorite people in small, autonomous, distributed expert teams. To help us secure amazing missions, we raised $5 million+ (not public, yet) from NFX, Village Global, and Box Group, along with the former CEO of Upwork, the founders of Fiverr and Lemonade, Apples Global Head of Recruiting, YC Partner Aaron Harris, Whartons Adam Grant, and Dukes Dan Ariely.

title: Sr. Product Designer (Remote)
description: About ApolloFounded in 2015, Apollo is a leading sales intelligence and engagement platform trusted by over 13,000 paying customers, from rapidly growing startups to the largest global enterprises.Our platform unifies a database of 200 million business contacts with advanced intelligence and engagement tools, to help over 500,000 sales, marketing, and recruiting professionals to connect with the right person at the right time with the right message, at speed and scale.In the last year, we’ve grown ARR 3x, quadrupled our active users, maintained profitability 18 out of the past 20 months, and recently closed a $110M Series C led by Sequoia to fuel the next phase of our growth.Working at ApolloWe are a remote-first inclusive organization focused on operational excellence. Our way of working ensures clear expectations and an environment to do your best work with ample reward. As a product-led organization, design & user experience are at the forefront of every decision that we make.Your Role & MissionWe are hiring a Senior Product Designer to help craft the future of Apollo. Product Designers serve a vital role here in helping us learn, test, and iterate to build the best experiences possible for our users. We appreciate designers who think deeply, speak clearly, love collaboration and feedback, and are always learning about best practices to master their craft!Our Product Managers, Design, and Engineering teams are structured as Squads that are focused on several core features of the product. You will be assigned to a Squad alongside one Product Manager and multiple Engineers. You will also regularly collaborate with designers from other pods to share learnings and ensure a cohesive user experience.Daily Adventures & Responsibilities Working with the Product Manager on your squad to help brainstorm, build & validate solutions to user problems & goals. Working with Engineers on your squad to understand constraints, hand off designs, and run design QA. Collaborating with your squad during Weekly Sprint Plannings & Daily Standups to ensure that we are building the best experience. Collaborating with other Designers to provide feedback, share + learn best practices & maintain a cohesive experience in the product. Interviewing users to validate designs & learn about user problems. Using & building upon our design system to update portions of your surface. Collaborating with your squad to identify the highest impact areas to work on, develop hypothesis, test, and iterate. Consistently integrating quantitative and qualitative data into essential product decisions. Skills & Competencies 4+ years of experience designing and shipping complex web-based products founded in data and customer insights. You have expert design instincts & best practice knowledge to translate user problems, user goals, business objectives and technical constraints into excellent product experiences to deliver quick turnarounds & shorten feedback loops. You’re a self-starter that thrives while working in a fast-paced environment, working on multiple projects simultaneously. You have experience creating and maintaining components across multiple product surfaces in Figma. You are a voracious learner, constantly trying to learn how to improve customer experience, drive core metrics. Continuously learns new industry standards, staying up to date with how to get the most out of modern design tools including Figma. You have a passion for typography and copywriting and know how to write a simple, compelling microcopy to support your UI design. You’re experimentation-oriented – You have the ability to conduct user interviews, analyze the results of interviews, form hypothesis, test hypothesis with users via prototypes or product experimentation, and iterate. No big ego – we can uphold excellent rhythms within our Product Management, Engineering & Design squads because each member has respect for each other, and has a shared understanding of the goals, vision, and principles that Apollo operates on. You’re highly interested in user-centric design – we like to push each other to stay at the cutting edge of our field :) What Youll Love About ApolloWe offer a competitive salary and benefits, informal, fun, and remote working environment. Our culture thrives in openness and excellence, and we invest tremendous effort into developing our remote employees’ careers.The team embraces that we have a sole purpose: to help customers maximize their full revenue potential on the Apollo platform. This mindset opens us up to a lot of creative approaches to making customers successful at scale.Our work environment is diverse with a global remote team, and we are intentional in building an inclusive culture where everyone can be the best version of themselves. We’re also very collaborative at Apollo, so you’ll be able to lean on your teammates, even in adjacent departments, to help you achieve lofty goals. You’ll be supported and encouraged to experiment and take educated risks that lead to big wins. And, you’ll have a whole team remotely by your side to help you do it!What Else? 📚 A monthly budget for learning and development. 🏝 Unlimited PTO 🍹 Team events

title: UI Web/Mobile Designer for E-Com Company

The proper candidate understands how to do research as to what are current best practices for a design element/web section and can then use our branding to create designs for us to A/B test.This job will have a test for the first round.To apply just message me here https://dribbble.com/hans-graubard

title: Senior Product Designer
description: ONLY ACCEPTING APPLICATIONS HERE: https://www.leadsimple.com/careers/senior-product-designer🚀 Want to join a team of A-players in an exciting, high-growth, entrepreneurial environment?‍We’re a fast-growing team solving big problems in the property management industry. Bootstrapped and profitable since 2013, were passionate about helping small businesses simplify growth, streamline operations, and deliver a great customer experience at scale.‍Our products provide a powerful foundation for property management companies to take their businesses to the next level. Thousands of property managers rely on us for their day-to-day operations and we’re only getting started.We want to increase the throughput of great ideas through the organization and into customers’ hands. We are driven, disciplined, clear-eyed about tradeoffs, and committed to moving fast without breaking things. Your mission, should you choose to accept it, is to maximize the value we’re delivering to customers, by discovering and validating the best approach to each problem, and designing a great solution we can build in a short amount of time. We follow the Shape Up Process, with influences from Marty Cagan (Silicon Valley Product Group) and the Lean Startup movement. If this excites you, let’s talk!‍Role Summary The Senior Product Designer owns the overall design & user experience of a product across the development lifecycle. They are an advocate for our customers, an important bridge between problems and creative solutions, and also between our internal teams. They perform user research, solve diverse problems, navigate the unknown, and work with the team to ideate, test, and deliver high-value solutions to customers.Ideal Candidate Has Experience In‍Discovery Continuous Discovery Problem Framing Customer Interviews - Problem Interviews, Solution Interviews Usability Testing Willingness to Pay Testing Design Sprints Product Analytics Risk Prioritization ‍Discovery Artifacts: Opportunity Solution Trees Customer Journey Maps Empathy Maps, Personas Use Cases User Story Maps Service Blueprints ‍Visual Design Conceptualizing Moodboarding Information Architecture Interaction Design Design Systems Design Tokens Rapid Prototyping, Functional Clickables High Fidelity Design ‍Delivery Experiment Design Analysis QA Testing ‍Bonus:Brand Design‍Expectations for your first 90 days: Develops a solid grasp of our product lines, feature sets, value proposition, business model, pricing, product development process, and documents this for the benefit of future product team members. Updates training material and onboarding process for future new hires by shadowing current team members Becomes an authority on product area & contributes Designs for current quarter Explores and prototypes 5 solutions to team objective New designs are tested with customers Presents 3 solution designs to product leadership Delivers 2 approved solutions in collaboration with engineering team and gathers feedback from 3-5 customers Leads Design for an objective ‍Perks: Monthly Friday Free Day Company Holidays Paid Time Off (in addition to the above) Monthly Healthcare Allowance Yearly Vacation Allowance Fun and busy work environment with smart, caring people Location independence Mission driven company and values-based culture Please only apply if you: Embrace learning new technology Learn fast Communicate crisply Proactively seek solutions Own the outcome Bring an optimistic “can do” attitude Supply your own internet and smartphone Bachelors Degree (preferred) Have B2B SaaS experience (preferred) 3 years demonstrated success in similar role ‍***NOTE: Hiring within the US (except CO, CA, NY) and in Central and South America***‍We have an amazing team of A-Players and we’re ready to add more! Selected candidates might have written assessments and multiple interviews with different people. We’ll do whatever it takes to get the right person in the right seat.‍If you think you would thrive in the above environment and make an impact for our customers, we’d love to talk to you!‍In summary...‍You can do it in an officeYou can do it from homeWe really don’t careAs long as it’s known 👇‍What matters is this…When the chips are downAnd your back is against the wallCan we count on you to make the right call?‍Judgment, intuition, or care by another nameWe call it “Owning The Outcome” - because it really is the whole gameHave the customers back, and they will treat you the same‍If you can do thatThen we’re birds of the same featherSo come join our team and we’ll make music together.

title: UI / UX Designer & Gaming Enthusiast
description: 🐬 Fluyo is a startup looking for a legendary UX designer who will transform our well designed & fun language learning app into an incredibly well designed & even more fun app! Someone who through data/research, good intuition and design taste will level up our product user’s experience to the maximum level.Our mission at Fluyo is to make the world speak another language by making language learning truly fun. We combine the most effective language education with all the fun of a video game.🧑‍🏫 Industry: Language Learning🧑‍💻 Seniority: Mid/Senior (you will be the primary UX/UI designer in our team)🏢 Company Size: 5 to 10 employees💰 Salary: €40k-55k EUR / $45k-60k USD per year📈 Equity: 0.1 - 0.25%Perks-⏱ Flexible working hours (work whenever you want, but be available to chat during core hours: 8-11am EST / 2-5pm CET)- 🌍 100% Remote working (our team is based in 7 different countries worldwide)- 💰 Funded on Kickstarter (highest funded app in Kickstarter history!)- 🚀 Make a real difference (we are publicly launching in several months, so this is a really exciting time to join!)- 🏖️ Unlimited vacation time: You are in charge of deciding when to work.- 🐣 Be an early team member + equity (as the company grows, your role will grow, and so will all the rewards!)- 😎 A chilled out team (we work hard, but we do not micromanage at all)Essential Skills Required 3+ years of UX experience, high level proficiency with Adobe XD / Figma, and an elegant & modern portfolio Experience in game design or extensive gaming experience (the majority of Fluyo is either a game or very gamified, we need someone who is familiar with common gaming mechanics) Your files, components, prototypes and designs are highly organized You love learning new languages and have used various language learning apps You love talking to customers/users to get product feedback and can turn this feedback into designs You possess a strong intuition for what you believe users would like based on your own experience (not solely relying on research & data) You absolutely love UX, and constantly think about how your designs will affect user happiness and success You enjoy working closely with developers to ensure your designs are implemented correctly The RoleYou will be the main product designer in the team, and will be responsible for taking our current (slightly messy) XD file and transforming it into a professional, modern UI kit & design. You will then be responsible for collecting and analyzing user feedback from our app, to determine what features users want added or improved, and then you will determine their feasibility and turn them into prototypes (and then full designs).You will be responsible for anything that users interact with (and how they exactly interact with) on the app. We want someone who is bright, hard working and has a great user experience and visual design taste. We want someone who can take charge over our product and envision all the potential ways our product’s user experience can be improved, design said improvements and work with our developers to ensure your designs are matched and do QA. Please add the word “Goldshire” to your application so we know you read this post completely. Ultimately, the goal of this role is to help make our app an absolute joy for our customers to use.Essentially, we need someone who is a professional and talented designer, but also someone who cares deeply about products and customers, and is always thinking about how to make our product more useful/enjoyable.This is a full time requirement (approx. 7 hours per day) for 1 designer. Please no agencies. We want someone who can commit to our team and focus exclusively on this. We are not looking for a freelancer who has multiple projects on at the same time.Our CompanyWere a language learning app that will completely change the way people learn languages. Were making a language learning app that is truly fun and addictive. It’s not simply “a gamified app”, it’s an actual game. A game that has been designed from the ground up to also be the most effective language learning system that’s ever existed. Other apps can be effective, but often are not truly fun and are very difficult to use consistently. Hence users rely on forcing themselves to use them.In contrast, our app inspires excitement, acts as a platform for learners to make friends, is extremely fun, easy to use consistently and therefore makes one’s language learning journey so much better. We just became the most funded app on Kickstarter ever, and you can see our campaign and learn more about our product here: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/550782470/fluyoInterview Process Application form (below) We review your portfolio, if we think you are potential fit, we’ll send you a small paid design / user flow critique test Video call with CTO & CEO Thanks so much for checking out our job! We cant wait to read your application and (hopefully) welcome you to our team! Even if this job is not a good fit for you, we will keep your contact details and email you about future jobs that fit your profile. We are going to be hiring a lot in 2023!

title: Senior Designer
description: Stacvalley, Germanys leading marketing agency for Amazon sellers, is on the lookout for a talented and experienced Senior Designer to join our dynamic and creative team. While our headquarters are in Germany, this specific role is open to candidates interested in working remotely.As a Senior Designer at Stacvalley, youll be responsible for designing and creating high-quality product images. Your creative abilities will play a pivotal role in narrating the story of each product and enticing buyers to press the purchase button.Responsibilities: Designing and creating appealing product images that highlight the USPs and foster buyer engagement. Collaborating with the marketing and product team to bolster the visual communication and brand identity of our clients on Amazon. Continuously updating and adapting to the latest design trends and best practices in the e-commerce industry. Adhering to project timelines and ensuring compliance with quality standards across all design projects. Qualifications: A minimum of three years of experience in a similar role, ideally in an agency specializing in Amazon or other e-commerce platforms. An impressive portfolio that showcases your ability to develop and implement creative concepts. Expert knowledge in common design software tools such as Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects, etc. Strong organizational skills and the ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment. Excellent communication skills and the ability to accept and implement constructive feedback. If youre passionate about delivering groundbreaking creative work and want to write the next chapter of your career in one of Germanys most successful agencies, we look forward to your application. Your creative abilities have the potential to create a ripple in the Amazon marketplace, and we cant wait to achieve that with you.

title: Graphic Designer
